;;周四（10 月 12 日），随着死亡人数上升和重要物资短缺，加沙距离人道主义灾难又近了一步。与此同时，在国际社会呼吁克制的情况下，以色列在预期的地面入侵之前在飞地边境集结了坦克，并表示在所有人质获释之前，不会暂停对加沙地带的围困以寻求援助或疏散。露西·菲尔德还有更多。;
;

;以色列军方周五呼吁加沙城所有平民（超过 100 万人）在 24 小时内向南迁移，因为;在预计的地面入侵之前，在加沙地带附近集结了坦克;。

;

;国防部长约夫·加兰特 (Yoav Gallant) 周四表示，“现在是战争时期”，以色列战机继续轰炸加沙，以报复哈马斯武装分子周末发动的袭击，造成 1,300 多名以色列人死亡，其中大部分是平民。

;

;以色列军方表示，未来几天将在加沙城进行“大规模”行动，平民只有在再次发布公告后才能返回。

;

;“加沙城的平民，为了自己的安全，向南撤离”军方在一份声明中表示：“为了你和家人的安全，远离那些利用你作为人肉盾牌的哈马斯恐怖分子。”

;

;“哈马斯恐怖分子躲藏在加沙城房屋下方和内部的隧道内。”建筑物内居住着无辜的加沙平民。”

;

;一名哈马斯官员表示，加沙搬迁警告是“虚假宣传”，并敦促公民不要上当。

;

;联合国表示，它考虑以色列驻联合国大使吉拉德·埃尔丹称，联合国对以色列向加沙居民发出的预警的反应是“可耻的” .

;

;以色列发誓要消灭周六领导袭击的哈马斯武装组织。

;

;以色列军方表示，一夜之间袭击了加沙北部的 750 个军事目标，其中包括据称的目标。哈马斯隧道、军事大院、高级特工住宅和武器储存仓库。

;

;然而，对加沙的地面入侵构成了严重风险，哈马斯扣押了在袭击中被绑架的数十名人质。

;

;拥有 230 万人口的加沙地带正遭到以色列的围困，自周末入侵以来，以色列对哈马斯在飞地的目标进行了袭击，并在报复性袭击中造成 1,500 多名巴勒斯坦人死亡。

;

;以色列国际委员会红十字会（红十字国际委员会）表示，加沙医院的应急发电机燃料可能会在数小时内耗尽，联合国世界粮食计划署（粮食计划署）警告说，粮食和淡水已经严重不足。

;

;“人类的苦难红十字国际委员会地区主任法布里奇奥·卡尔博尼表示：“这种升级造成的冲突是令人憎恶的，我恳求双方减少平民的痛苦。”

;

;联合国巴勒斯坦难民署（近东救济工程处）表示，它已将其中心行动地点转移到其他地方。该机构在社交媒体平台 X 上表示：“我们敦促以色列当局保护近东救济工程处避难所中的所有平民，包括学校。”为了为其应对措施争取支持，以色列政府向美国国务卿安东尼·布林肯和北约国防部长展示了;图形; 他们称哈马斯在以色列周末的暴乱中杀害了儿童和平民。

;

;布林肯说，他们展示了一名“布满弹孔”的婴儿，士兵被斩首，年轻人在车内被烧伤。 “这简直是最糟糕的堕落，”他说。 “这确实超出了我们所能理解的范围。”

;

;与世界各地的其他人一样，布林肯敦促以色列表现出克制，但他也;重申美国的支持;，并表示：“我们将永远站在你们一边。”

;

;周五，他将与约旦国王阿卜杜拉会面布林肯还计划访问美国的主要盟友卡塔尔、沙特，这是旨在阻止战争蔓延的中东之行的一部分。阿拉伯、埃及和阿拉伯联合酋长国 - 其中一些对伊朗支持的伊斯兰组织哈马斯有影响力。

;

;以色列军事参谋长赫兹·哈勒维中将表示，将从加沙周围的安全失败中吸取教训，启用了攻击。他说：“我们将学习、调查，但现在是战争的时候了。”土耳其外交部长哈坎·菲丹周五与阿联酋外长举行电话会议，讨论加沙地带的人道主义局势。外交部消息人士称。

;

;土耳其已提出调解冲突，并希望向受战斗影响的巴勒斯坦人提供人道主义援助。菲丹将于周五前往埃及就地区问题进行会谈。

;

;土耳其外交部周五敦促黎巴嫩公民远离该国南部，因为那里的以色列和巴勒斯坦军队之间发生了战斗。

;

;美国军方对其安全援助;不设任何条件;美国国防部长劳埃德·奥斯汀表示，美国国防部长劳埃德·奥斯汀表示，华盛顿希望以色列军队在对哈马斯发动战争时“做正确的事情”。

;

;奥斯汀将于周五抵达以色列，并计划会见以色列总理本杰明·内塔尼亚胡。

;

;哈马斯呼吁巴勒斯坦人周五起来;抗议以色列轰炸;飞地，敦促巴勒斯坦人向东耶路撒冷的阿克萨清真寺游行，并在被占领的约旦河西岸与以色列军队发生冲突。

;

;美国白宫表示，从周五开始，美国国务院将开始提供飞往欧洲的包机，帮助美国人离开以色列（如果他们愿意的话）。

;

;日本已为希望离开的公民安排了周六从特拉维夫起飞的包机以色列内阁官房长官松野博和周五对记者表示。

;

;这场冲突在欧洲引发了一些内乱，巴黎有警察;使用催泪瓦斯和高压水枪驱散支持巴勒斯坦人民的被禁止的集会;。阿姆斯特丹和伦敦的一些犹太学校;出于安全考虑暂时关闭;。< /p>;

;纽约和洛杉矶的美国执法官员表示，他们周五加强了警力部署，特别是在犹太教堂和犹太社区中心周围，但一些官员试图淡化威胁。

;<阿拉伯倡导组织阿拉伯裔美国反歧视委员会周四表示，联邦调查局特工走访了不同州的清真寺以及有巴勒斯坦血统的美国居民，称这是“令人不安的趋势”。在耶路撒冷，数十名以色列人周四聚集在赫茨尔山军事公墓埋葬死者。

;

;“当你没有接我的电话时，我知道你正在全力战斗。当我意识到时你失踪了，我无法想象事情会这样结束。”一位哀悼者说道。

;

;在加沙南部主要城市;Khan Younis;，那里的墓地已经满了，死者被埋在空地上，就像周三晚上在一场谋杀案中被杀的萨穆尔家族一样。袭击击中了他们的房屋。

;

;巴勒斯坦救援人员易卜拉欣·哈姆丹 (Ibrahim Hamdan) 开车从一个炸弹地点前往另一个炸弹地点，他的团队试图从被以色列空袭摧毁的房屋中救出幸存者。

;

;“这战争的残酷程度超乎想象，”自 2007 年成为救援人员以来多次经历战争的哈姆丹说。“他们把高楼推倒在居民身上。”

;

;加沙人，主要是加沙人的后裔。自 1948 年以色列建国以来，逃离或被驱逐出以色列家园的难民自 16 年前哈马斯夺取政权以来，遭受了经济崩溃和以色列在封锁下的多次轰炸。

;

;近几个月来，巴勒斯坦人的愤怒情绪不断高涨以色列在约旦河西岸进行了多年来最致命的镇压，其右翼政府正在谈论夺取更多土地。旨在建立巴勒斯坦国的和平进程十年前崩溃了，巴勒斯坦领导人表示，这让人民没有希望，极端主义势力不断壮大。

;

; Fri, 13 Oct 2023 14:25:04 +0800 Why Turkey could miss Erdogan“s earthquake reconstruction deadlinehttps://reuters.com/article/turkey-quake-reconstruction/turkey-earthquake-why-reconstruction-could-miss-erdogans-goal-idUSKBN31D0DH
;;2023-10-13T06:06:20Z;
;

;伊斯梅特·卡普兰 (Ismet Kaplan) 躲在一个改装的集装箱里，等待听听他是否有资格获得总统数十万套住房中的一栋塔伊普·埃尔多安 (Tayyip Erdogan) 承诺将重建在二月份现代土耳其最严重的地震中被毁坏的房屋。

;

;地震发生几天后，随着全国大选的临近，埃尔多安做出了大胆的承诺。他表示，尽管幸存者仍在从废墟中走出来，但一半的灾区将;一年内重建;——总共 319,000 人八个月过去了，十多名官员、建筑商和工程师告诉路透社，建筑成本上升和经济不确定性阻碍了企业竞标政府重建合同，使得这一最后期限看起来很难实现，尤其是在受灾最严重的地区。

;

;在受灾严重的阿德亚曼市，计划中的新建筑的一小部分正在施工，卡普兰担心与他残疾的妻子和其他幸存者一起等待很长时间。 2 月 6 日灾难发生后，他们在临时住房的集装箱中暴露在夏季和冬季的温度下。

;

;“我相信需要数年时间才能搬走，”公寓楼倒塌的卡普兰说。在地震中。他的女儿、儿媳和四个孙子在倒塌的建筑物下丧生。

;

;根据政府自己的说法，到 11 月底将有 40,000 套房屋竣工，剩下三个月的时间才能在 2 月份完成近 280,000 套房屋的建设.

;

;一位直接了解重建计划的高级政府官员表示，由于成本上升，没有足够的新资金来举行新的招标，因此该目标可能无法实现。另一位官员也提到了预算限制，并表示需要采取新措施来加快进度。

;

;他们都表示，在选举后的经济政策 U-之后，投标重建招标的公司越来越少，因此这项努力受到了打击。六月的转折导致货币暴跌。

;

;官员们要求匿名以便畅所欲言。

;

;在回答路透社的问题时，埃尔多安办公室表示建设工作按计划进行，符合宣布的目标，称 20 万套房屋的工程已经开始，“已完工的房屋将在 10 月、11 月和 12 月分阶段交付。”

;

;“灾区是政府的首要任务”，并否认工程进度放缓。招标，但未提供具体数字。

;

;根据路透社对最新公共部门数据的审查，截至 8 月 6 日，地震后六个月内有 123,000 套房屋正在建设中。

;

; >;

;该部门的数据还显示，政府承诺在地震发生后两年内在阿德亚曼省完工的近 65,000 套房屋中，只开始了 7% 的建设。

;

;Ufuk Bayir，该部秘书长阿德亚曼的土耳其工程师和建筑师协会（TMMOB）表示，更多房屋的建设工作现已开始，但预计到年底只会向阿德亚曼居民交付几百套。 TMMOB 与土耳其左翼反对派结盟。

;

;“我认为不可能在一年内交付所有房屋，”同时也是阿德亚曼省协调委员会成员的巴伊尔说。

;<卡普兰是一位退休的法庭书记员，他定期查看官方的在线住房门户网站。他说，他六月份的住房申请在上个月得到了第一个答复，称他的请求正在“评估”。

;

;“我们没有其他地方可以住，我不知道我们将如何生存冬天，”卡普兰说。

;

;灾区仍有数以万计的建筑物等待拆除，与卡普兰一样，随着冬季临近，该地区气温可能降至零下以下，许多幸存者仍留在帐篷和集装箱房屋中。

;

;黎明前的地震震慑了相当于荷兰和比利时两国面积总和的地区，将纺织和农业重镇东南部的整个城镇和市中心夷为平地，造成 50,000 多人死亡。

;

; >;

;近 300,000 栋建筑物倒塌或无法使用，数百万人无家可归，其中包括来自邻国叙利亚的战争难民 - 叙利亚地震也造成数千人死亡。

;

;埃尔多安表示，总共 680,000 栋房屋将在两年内完工根据政府资助的计划，房主将在 20 年内免息偿还费用。

;

;公共网站显示 4 月份每天约有 5 个项目招标，5 月份招标速度放缓。该数据于 5 月 31 日停止披露。路透社无法确定此后已发出了多少次招标。城市化部没有回应路透社关于为何停止发布数据的问题。

;

;城市化部、国家住房局 (TOKI) 和公共采购部门没有回应路透社的问题最新的建设数据。

;

;城市化部长穆罕默德·奥扎塞基和其他政府官员公开支持埃尔多安的最后期限。这位部长在 9 月中旬承认，对于 TOKI 来说，建造如此多的房屋“不是一件容易的事”，而该公司通常每年建造 60,000-70,000 套房屋。

;

;上周，此举可能有助于加快重建速度总统办公室发布法令，允许向灾区房主提供赠款和无息贷款，用于建造自己的房屋。

;

;在受灾严重的哈塔伊、马拉蒂亚、阿德亚曼和卡赫拉曼马拉斯，这些地区合计占近 80%路透社对官方数据的分析显示，到 2025 年计划建造的房屋中，到 8 月份只有 15% 的工程已经开工。总统表示，哈塔伊和卡赫拉曼马拉斯城市的进度并未落后于计划。

;

;其他受影响省份、加济安泰普和较小的基利斯也取得了更多进展，到 8 月，约 45,000 套房屋中的大约一半已开始施工官方数据显示，承诺期限为两年。政府没有回答有关为什么这些地区的工作进展得更快的问题。

;

;Arvid 表示，灾后重建通常需要数年时间才能提供规划良好的供水、污水处理、电力系统以及其他基础设施欧洲复兴开发银行土耳其董事总经理图尔克纳在 9 月份访问灾区后接受采访时表示。

;

;东南部重建工作的任何延误都可能影响全国地方投票。今年 3 月，埃尔多安的正义与发展党 (AKP) 旨在恢复 2019 年输给反对派的伊斯坦布尔、安卡拉和其他大城市的市政府。

;

;Mert Arslanalp，伊斯坦布尔海峡大学政治学助理教授，说埃尔多安在一年内重建该地区的承诺帮助他在五月总统选举中维持了支持。

;

;“因此，未能兑现他的承诺可能会对地方选举产生影响，”阿尔斯拉纳尔普说。< /p>;

;3 月份，安卡拉估计地震造成的损失为 1040 亿美元，并表示重建费用将占一半以上。

;

;财政部长穆罕默德·西姆塞克 (Mehmet Simsek) 6 月份上任后表示，这场灾难对预算造成了影响占GDP的近10%是“巨大的”，主要是在两年内感受到的。此次地震占今年预期预算赤字占 GDP 比例的近一半。

;

;;2023-10-12T10:24:17Z;
;

;BEIJING (Reuters) -General Liu Zhenli, the head of the military body responsible for China's combat operations and planning, has emerged as the top contender to replace the country's defence minister, who has not been seen in public for more than six weeks, according to five people familiar with the matter.

;;
;;The Chinese flag flutters on Tiananmen Square before the opening session of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference (CPPCC) in Beijing, China May 21, 2020. REUTERS/Carlos Garcia Rawlins/File Photo;
;

;The appointment of Liu to replace Defence Minister Li Shangfu - which one of the people said was likely to happen before Beijing holds an international security forum later this month - could boost military engagement with the United States amid regional tensions, three military analysts told Reuters.

;

;Li was sanctioned by the US in 2018 for an arms deal he secured with Russia in an earlier role.中国要求取消限制措施，包括签证禁令和禁止在美国进行金融交易。 Liu, 59, is not under Western sanctions.

;

;Currently the Chief of the Joint Staff Department of the Central Military Commission (CMC), Liu was described as Li's likely replacement by a person with direct knowledge of the matter, as well as two people close to the military and two regional officials with close knowledge of Chinese politics. They spoke on condition of anonymity due to the confidential nature of the information.

;

;China's defence ministry and State Council information office did not respond to requests for comment. Reuters was unable to reach Liu himself for comment.

;

;A US Department of Defense spokesperson declined to comment on Liu's possible appointment but said the US “continues to believe in the importance of maintaining open lines of military-to-military communication” with China.

;

;Li's absence has not been officially explained, though Reuters reported last month that he was under investigation for corrupt procurement of military equipment in a previous role.

;

;If his departure is confirmed, Li will be the second senior minister to lose his job in recent months.

;

;Qin Gang was removed as foreign minister in July, one month after he was last seen in public.

;

;It is unclear whether Li will retain his position as one of China's five state councillors, a post outranking a regular minister. Qin has not been officially removed from his post as state councillor.

;

;Any decision to improve military-to-military ties - frozen by Beijing when then-US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited Taipei in August 2022 - would be made by President Xi Jinping, who has the ultimate say in all important policies and appointments.

;

;Xi is also Commander-in-Chief of the armed forces and chair of the CMC, China's top defence decision-making body, on which Liu already sits.

;

;The person with direct knowledge of the matter said Liu's appointment would likely be announced before foreign defence officials visit Beijing on Oct. 29-31 for the Xiangshan Forum, a major international security seminar.

;

;Procedurally, the appointment and removal of high-level officials is announced by the National People's Congress Standing Committee, which takes guidance from the Chinese Communist Party's elite Politburo. The politburo is expected to meet at the end of this month.

;

;“If Xi Jinping is indeed intent on re-engaging in top-level military engagement with the US, this could well present an opportunity for the Pentagon to finally reconnect with the (People's Liberation Army) high command,” said James Char, a scholar at Singapore's S. Rajaratnam School of International Studies.

;

;Reuters reported Wednesday that Washington has accepted an invitation to the Xiangshan Forum, though it is unlikely that Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin will personally attend.

;

;China's Minister of National Defence has a largely diplomatic role with no direct command authority. The post is subordinate to a handful of other officials from the CMC, including the two vice chairmen under Xi.

;

;Liu's appointment could elevate the profile of the job, five analysts and military attaches told Reuters.

;

;His recent experience leading the Joint Staff Department would allow foreign counterparts to deal with a figure at the centre of China's military operations and war planning, rather than a mere technocrat.

;

;US defence officials have long wanted to reestablish routine communications with counterparts directly involved in command decisions.

;

;“This could really help breathe some oxygen into China's military diplomacy,” said Singapore-based defence analyst Alexander Neill, an adjunct fellow at the Pacific Forum, a foreign policy research institute in Honolulu.

;

;“Finally, the US might have someone they would really want to talk to,” he said.

;

;Liu is also one of the few recent Chinese military leaders with combat experience, having been involved in intense border fights with Vietnamese troops in 1986 - part of years of skirmishes that followed Beijing's invasion of northern Vietnam in 1979, according to Chinese media reports.

;

;Defence diplomacy is seen by diplomats and analysts as an important part of Xi's push for a modernized military that can support China's growing international interests.

;

;China's ships and planes will need greater access to ports and bases internationally to achieve Xi's goal of becoming the dominant world power.

;

;The removal of two senior ministers in such quick succession “highlights the severe limitation of Xi's one-man rule,” said Willy Lam, senior fellow at US think tank Jamestown Foundation.

;

;“He prioritised loyalty over capability and honesty when choosing who to put in power. Look how they turned out?”

;

;Xi has made combating corruption a priority, particularly within the military, since he first became president. His defenders say the centralisaton of power is needed if China is successfully to navigate global tensions.

;

;Qin was made foreign minister in Dec. 2022 and Li became defence minister in March. State news agency Xinhua reported in October 2022 that Xi decided on the senior appointments after personally conducting interviews with all the prospective candidates.

;

;Air Force commander Chang Dingqiu is set to take over from Liu as Chief of the Joint Staff Department, according to three of the people familiar with the situation.

;

;North Korea denounced on Friday a US aircraft carrier's visit to South Korea, calling it a provocation that could bring "irrevocable, catastrophic circumstances".

;The nuclear-powered Ronald Reagan and its strike group ;arrived; in the South Korean port of Busan on Thursday for a five-day visit, after allied exercises in nearby waters, in a show of force against North Korea.

;

;North Korea calls the drills a rehearsal for invasion.

;Our "most powerful and rapid first strike will be given to the 'extended deterrence' means, used by the US to hallucinate its followers, and the bases of evil in the Korean peninsula and its vicinity," KCNA said.

;;2023-10-13T04:05:14Z;
;

;Palestinian rescue worker Ibrahim Hamdan has been on duty almost constantly since Saturday, dodging ;Israeli air strikes; that have killed paramedics even as his team tries to pull survivors from houses destroyed by the relentless pounding of the tiny enclave.

;

;Israel's ;bombardment of Gaza; began on Saturday soon after the armed wing of the militant Islamist group Hamas governing the enclave smashed through barriers to send hundreds of fighters ;marauding; through Israeli towns, killing 1,200 soldiers and civilians including children, Israel's military says.

;

;The bombardment is the ;most intense; Israel has ever directed at ;Gaza;, which is only 40km (25 miles) long and home to 2.3 million people living in cramped cities and refugee camps with few designated shelters and nowhere else to run.

;

;So many buildings have been destroyed, including many occupied by civilians, that rescue services were struggling to reach new bomb sites quickly. Hamdan said he was attending about 10 calls a day, some lasting hours.

;

;Explosions from air strikes echo every few minutes - killing more than 1,500 people in Gaza so far including hundreds of children, local health authorities say.

;

;Roads cratered from direct hits or blocked by rubble from nearby strikes hinder progress and initial rescue work is often done by neighbours pulling away chunks of debris in search of survivors or hoping to retrieve bodies for burial.

;

;Lacking enough heavy machinery such as mechanical diggers and bulldozers, rescue workers also rely on shovels and other tools they wield by hand to pull away rubble.

;

;The emotional toll has been intense.

;

;Hamdan, 39, has a bandage on his left hand and wrist, injured by falling debris during a rescue attempt on Wednesday when he was only able to pull out the bodies of two girls, dead in the ruins of their home in the south Gaza city of Khan Younis, where he is based with his team of 12 other government rescue workers.

;

;"I couldn't stop thinking about my own four daughters," he said, adding that all that keeps him going is the hope of finding more survivors.

;

;On Wednesday, four Palestine Red Crescent emergency medical workers were killed when their ambulances were hit in two different incidents. Their colleagues clung to each other afterwards, shaking with sobs, video posted by Palestine Red Crescent showed.

;

;Two of Hamdan's own team were injured by flying glass when an air strike blew the windows out of their ambulance in Khan Younis on Saturday, he said. Neither is badly hurt.

;

;Ashraf Al-Qidra, the spokesman of the Gaza health ministry said 10 medical staffers had been killed so far and 14 health facilities damaged, including the lone hospital in Beit Hanoun in northern Gaza.

;

;Israel's armed forces did not immediately respond to requests for comment about strikes injuring rescuers and medics.

;

;Snatching little more than an hour of sleep at a time, and no more than two hours over a day and night, Hamdan and the others in his team barely have time to eat or phone their families.

;

;"I have been so frightened that at some point I will get a call to head out to a rescue and it will be my family," Hamdan said.

;

;Hamdan tries to talk to his wife and six children aged from his daughter Maisa, 13, down to baby son Muhannad, between rescues, using video calls to see their faces. "I feel like I'm going blind until I make that call," he said.

;

;In previous wars, Israel often gave a few minutes notice to residents of blocks it intended to target but Gaza residents say it has not done so this time.

;

;"This war is harsh beyond imagining. They are collapsing people's buildings without warning. They knock down high-rise buildings on top of their residents," said Hamdan, who has worked through repeated wars since becoming a rescuer for the Gaza government in 2007.

;

;In one Reuters video a missile could be seen ploughing into the base of a 10-storey building in Gaza City on Thursday, causing a massive explosion as the surrounding area was engulfed in a cloud of smoke and dust.

;

;Late on Wednesday, medical worker Rami Ali was shown in a Palestine Red Crescent video sitting in an ambulance crying into his hand, his body heaving, after watching the bodies of children being taken from a building.

;

;Hamdan works for the Civil Emergency department, the fire and rescue service operated by the Gaza government, which Hamas has controlled since seizing power in the enclave during a brief Palestinian civil war in 2007.

;

;Israel and Hamas have repeatedly clashed during that time, with air strikes hitting targets in Gaza. Hamdan said that as in previous violence, the civil emergency team was currently operating out of schools, believing them to be safer from attack.

;

;"We are on alert all the time. There is bombing everywhere. There are injured and martyrs everywhere. So if I get one hour sleep I will be happy," Hamdan said.

;;
;;Prime Minister and Labour Party Leader Chris Hipkins speaks at the New Zealand Labour Party's election campaign launch event in Auckland, New Zealand, September 2, 2023. REUTERS/David Rowland/File Photo;
;

;New Zealand Prime Minister Chris Hipkins on Friday urged voters to get out and re-elect Labour in Saturday's national election, as polls indicate a change in government after six years of left-wing rule.

;

;Hipkins, who took over as prime minister in January when Jacinda Ardern made the surprise decision to step down, has struggled to win back swing voters disenfranchised with the Labour Party, which they blame for long COVID-19 lockdowns and a huge rise in the cost of living.

;

;However, Hipkins, 45 said Labour was starting to see momentum build in the final hours of campaigning.

;

;“We are expecting a really huge turnout ... and we're expecting a really strong result tomorrow night," Hipkins, 45, told reporters.

;

;The opposition centre-right National Party is ahead in the polls but is very unlikely to get a majority even with the support of its preferred coalition partner, the libertarian ACT Party.

;

;Polls predict that the nationalist New Zealand First Party will hold the balance of power. The party was Labour's coalition partner in 2017 but has said it will not work with Labour again.

;

;National Party leader Christopher Luxon said on Friday there was a “very big mood for change” in the country.

;

;“MMP ;(mixed member proportional); elections are always close. If you want change, you can't rely on other people to do it, you've got to vote for it,” Luxon, 53, told media.

;

;Both leaders organised walkabouts on Friday to woo an undecided voter bloc of about 9%. Hipkins even got on stage for a dance.

;

;Over a million New Zealanders have already voted in advanced voting with nearly two million still expected to cast their ballots before voting closes at 7 pm (0600 GMT) Saturday.

;

;Although a provisional result will likely be available on Saturday night, it is unlikely the next government will be known as coalition deals will need to be negotiated.

;

;“Polls tend to suggest we are looking at a centre-right coalition but the increasing degree of support for some of the smaller third parties introduces a little bit more uncertainty about that,” said Westpac Chief Economist Kelly Eckhold.

;

;“Thinking about the election, markets are particularly focused on the extent to which we get a clean result as opposed to potentially protracted coalition negotiations."

;;2023-10-13T02:59:00Z;
;

;Dozens of relatives of prisoners jailed in El Salvador during a state of emergency called on Thursday on the Supreme Court to rule unconstitutional upcoming "mass trials" of suspected gang members.

;

;El Salvador's Congress, controlled by President Nayib Bukele's ruling party, approved ;special emergency provisions; in July that allow people with established links to various gang structures to be tried in a group.

;

;This means that the Attorney General's office can use the same evidence to try people linked by factors such as the area where crimes were committed within a two-year period.

;

;But some critics fear that innocent people captured during a crackdown on El Salvador's gangs - or maras - launched in March last year could be convicted along with guilty gang members.

;

;"This law is perverse and arbitrary, what it wants is to condemn many innocent people," Samuel Ramirez of the Movement of Victims of the Regime (MOVIR), which is helping the relatives of suspects, told journalists.

;

;"If a person lived in a community controlled by a gang and that gang committed a crime, he will be blamed for that crime."

;

;In July, Justice Minister Gustavo Villatoro said up to 900 defendants from the same criminal cell could be tried together. Provisions came into force in August but a date for the trials has yet to be set.

;

;The Ministry of Justice and courts did not immediately respond to requests for comment.

;

;Bukele, who is standing for re-election in February even though the constitution prohibits consecutive presidential terms, is pushing on with the popular anti-gang crackdown that has brought more than 73,000 arrested.

;

;An important element of the campaign is a "mega-prison", 45 miles (73 km) southeast of the capital, that holds about 12,000 suspected members of the Mara Salvatrucha (MS-13) and rival Barrio 18 gangs.

;

;Authorities say it is the largest prison in the Americas and can hold about 40,000 prisoners.
